datasource: Mous, Maarten. 1993. A Grammar of Iraqw. Kuschitische Sprachstudien, 9. Hamburg: Helmut Buske Verlag. [M93]
geodemoTXT: Varieties and subdialects of the South Cushitic language Iraqw are spoken in Tanzania ZZManyara region: Mbulu district, highlands southwest of Arusha in the north; Singida region near Manyara border; small areas in Arusha and Dodoma regionsZZ.

termclusters.label: irq-Pronoun
termclusters.note: M93p.113 :: The demonstratives are:near1 í~ká,near2 síng,mid qá’,far dá’.

termclusters.label: irq-SelectorSelBEObjIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.127(6,7) :: impersonal = ‘impersonal’;HIT = ‘hither’;REC = reciprocal. p. 131(10) gives reverse index by form for all iraqw-VSelector paradigms.

termclusters.label: irq-SelectorSelBEVerbIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.125(5) :: Independent paradigm same as locative.

termclusters.label: irq-SelectorSelectorForms1IndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93pp.123-154 :: Mous calls this section “The verbs ‘to be’” rather than “selector”. In any case nearly every sentence in Iraqw contains a selector/”verb to be” whether the complement is nominal or verbal. [Ex:tlee’use a Manda [potters COP Bantu]‘Potters are Bantu’;aníng a goo’—ïim [1.SG BE write-DUR:1.SG]‘I am writing’]

termclusters.label: irq-SelectorSelectorForms2IndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.130(9) :: The template note is: persObe + selBE + selMood + selTense

termclusters.label: irq-VerbConj1-firiim-PresentIndicativeNegative
termclusters.note: M93p.169(34) :: The negative tenses are formed from the present or past plus infinitive with suffix -ká :: The vowel preceding -ká is lengthened. This rule applies after the syllable reduction rule,which deletes the short vowel of a syllable between two syllables with short vowls;see rule(4) in 2.3.

termclusters.label: irq-VerbConj1-koom-PresentIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.156(21) :: Conj 1:verbs eding in -m- in 1 sg(includes all verbs ending in durative derivational suffix -m). Conj 2:verbs ending in -Vw- in 1 sg(includes all  verbs with inchoative suffix -uw). Minimal selector as in iraqw-VPresConj3e-doohl.

termclusters.label: irq-VerbConj2-tlaw-PresentIndicativeNegative

This rule applies after the syllable reduction rule,which deletes the short vowel of a syllable between two syllables with short vowls;see rule(4) in 2.3.

termclusters.label: irq-VerbConj2b-xwaylu-PresentIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.156(21) :: Conj 1:verbs eding in -m- in 1 sg(includes all verbs ending in durative derivational suffix -m). Conj 2:verbs ending in -Vw- in 1 sg(includes all verbs with inchoative suffix -uw). Minimal selector as in iraqw-VPresConj3e-doohl.

termclusters.label: irq-VerbConj3a-looh-PresentIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.158(24) :: In general the vowel of the final sylable in class III verbs is long in the first and third persons singular and short in the second person singular.(p.157) See(25) p. 158,for verbs with vowel shortening preceding the 1.PL suffix,and(26) p. 159 for verbs with short vs long stem vowel for 3.SG.M subjunctive. Verbs ending in -h- with a long stem vowel shorten it word-finally(cf. long vowel in pl 1 of looh- below.

termclusters.label: irq-VerbConj3b-tsaweer-PresentIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.158(24) :: In general the vowel of the final sylable in class III verbs is long in the first and third persons singular and short in the second person singular.(p.157) See(25) p. 158,for verbs with vowel shortening preceding the 1.PL suffix,and(26) p. 159 for verbs with short vs long stem vowel for 3.SG.M subjunctive. Verbs ending in -h- with a long stem vowel shorten it word-finally(cf. long vowel in pl 1 of looh- below.

termclusters.label: irq-Verbmorph-Infinitive-
termclusters.note: M93p.167-168 :: Mous infinitivesuffix can occur after various types of subordinate clause with a generalizing or irrealis function. It is also used in the formation of the main clause negative and interrogative tenses.

termclusters.label: irq-Verbmorph-SelBE-IndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.143(13,14) :: impersonal = ‘impersonal’;HIT = ‘hither’;REC = reciprocal. p. 131(10) gives reverse index by form for all iraqw-VSelector paradigms :: The perfect form of the hither is na.

termclusters.label: irq-Verbmorph-StemFormation-Conj3a-oh-PresentIndicativeAffirmative
termclusters.note: M93p.156(22) :: Conj 3:all verbs not belonging to Conj 1,2.(See iraqw-VPresConj3Sg1-2.) :: Conj 3a:verbs ending in h with short fowel in final syllable. Conj 3b:verbs in r. Conj 3token-verbs ending in VVw. Conj 3d:verbs ending in VVy. Conj 3e:verbs ending in other consonants.(Minimal selector as in iraqw-VPresConj3e-doohl.)
